title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1202.3 - Stopping, standing or parking
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1202.3 - Stopping, standing or parking

State Regulations

Picking up or discharging passengers and/or property in
toll areas is specifically prohibited. Vehicles shall not stop, stand or park
upon vehicular crossings except: (a) when necessary to avoid injury or damage to persons or property, (b) while paying tolls, (c) in obedience to traffic signals or to an
order, signal or direction of any member of the Port Authority police force, or
(d) when unable to proceed
because of the disability of the vehicle; provided, however, that vehicles may
be parked in such places as may be designated by the manager or his duly
authorized representative. Repairs and tire changes shall not be made in or
upon vehicular crossings except when authorized by a member of the Port

Authority police force and under his direction. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21

1202.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
